EFL 'That's what I think' Blaise Matuidi reveals Andres Iniesta backed Marco Verratti to become his successor at Barcelona with mid-game comment during PSG thrashing 
Verratti was sensational during PSG's 4-0 Champions League rout of Barcelona and ran rings round Iniesta and Co By ALEC SHILTON Click to share on Facebook (Opens in new window) Comments ANDRES INIESTA gave Marco Verratti a mid-game backing to replace him at Barcelona during their Paris Saint-Germain thrashing. 
That is according to Blaise Matuidi , who tried to wind up the Blaugrana great as Verratti ran rings around them. Getty Images 5 Verratti dominated the midfield battle with Iniesta in Paris 
The Italy international, 24, was influential for PSG as they ran out 4-0 winners , playing 70 minutes before coming off injured. 
Keep up to date with ALL the Barcelona news, gossip, transfers and goals on our club page plus fixtures, results and live match commentary 
Midfield team-mate Matuidi revealed that at one point during the game he turned to Iniesta and told him exactly what he though of Verratti’s display. 
He claims to have said: “A sentence I remember in the game? One can remember a phrase I said to Iniesta. "When Verratti was on the ground, I told him that he was his replacement. 
"He (Iniesta) said, "Yes, that's what I think." 
"Iniesta is an extraordinary player, he arrives at a certain age, but he does very great things.
